title: 111_hr2613
content:
Section 1 of the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990 is amended by adjusting differentials as follows: The Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990 is amended to adjust differentials for various areas, including Atlanta, Boston, Buffalo, Chicago, Cincinnati, Cleveland, Columbus, Dallas, Dayton, and Denver. The following metropolitan areas have been adjusted for differentials under the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990:
- Collins-Loveland, CO, MSA
- Detroit-Warren-Flint, MI, CSA
- Hartford-West Hartford-Willimantic, CT, CSA
- Houston-Baytown-Huntsville, TX, CSA
- Huntsville-Decatur, AL, CSA
- Indianapolis-Anderson-Columbus, IN, CSA
- Los Angeles-Long Beach-Riverside, CA, CSA
- Miami-Fort Lauderdale-Pompano Beach, FL, MSA
- Milwaukee-Racine-Waukesha, WI, CSA
- Minneapolis-St. Paul-St. Cloud, MN-WI, CSA The metropolitan areas with adjusted percentages under the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990 are as follows:
- New York-Newark-Bridgeport, NY-NJ-CT-PA, CSA, plus Monroe County, PA, and Warren County, NJ
- Philadelphia-Camden-Vineland, PA-NJ-DE-MD, CSA, plus Kent County, DE, Atlantic County, NJ, and Cape May County, NJ
- Phoenix-Mesa-Scottsdale, AZ, MSA
- Pittsburgh-New Castle, PA, CSA
- Portland-Vancouver-Beaverton, OR-WA, MSA, plus Marion County, OR, and Polk County, OR
- Raleigh-Durham-Cary, NC, CSA, plus Fayetteville, NC, MSA, Goldsboro, NC, MSA, and Federal Correctional Complex, Butner, NC
- Richmond, VA, MSA
- Sacramento-Arden-Arcade-Yuba City, CA-NV, CSA The metropolitan areas with adjusted percentages under the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990 include Sacramento-Arden-Arcade-Yuba City, CA-NV, CSA with 39.35%, San Diego-Carlsbad-San Marcos, CA, MSA with 43.49%, San Jose-San Francisco-Oakland, CA, CSA with 59.65%, Seattle-Tacoma-Olympia, WA, CSA with 39.35%, and Washington-Baltimore-Northern Virginia, DC-MD-VA-WV, CSA with 53.94%. Additionally, special rules apply to certain counties in Rhode Island, Maine, and other areas. The amendment includes treating certain areas as part of the Boston-Worcester-Lawrence Consolidated Metropolitan Statistical Area and considers Capitol Police as law enforcement officers under the Federal Law Enforcement Pay Reform Act of 1990. The amendment's effective date aligns with the enactment of the Pay Reform Act and applies to pay for service in specific periods. SEC. 2. LIMITATION ON PREMIUM PAY. Amends Section 5547 of title 5, United States Code by removing references to specific sections and including criminal investigators under availability pay. Effective date aligns with the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2002.
